meanings.sent1: Tommy is always the jugheads in our group, making silly mistakes.
meanings.sent2: Don't be a jugheads and forget your keys at home.
meanings.sent3: The jugheads tried to juggle eggs and ended up with a mess.
meanings.sent4: His stubbornness made him the jugheads of the family, always insisting on his way.
meanings.sent5: The jugheads in the story never learned from their mistakes, causing chaos wherever they went.

meanings.definition: A person with a large or protruding forehead.
meanings.sent1: The baby in the picture had a cute little jugheads that made everyone smile.
meanings.sent2: The actor's distinctive jugheads made him stand out in the crowd.
meanings.sent3: With his jugheads, he could easily balance a book on his head.
meanings.sent4: Her jugheads seemed to catch the light, giving her a unique appearance.
meanings.sent5: The jugheads of the statue made it look wise and thoughtful.

meanings.definition: A person who is clumsy or awkward in their movements.
meanings.sent1: Sarah tripped over her own feet, proving she was a true jugheads.
meanings.sent2: The jugheads bumped into the table, spilling the drinks everywhere.
meanings.sent3: The jugheads danced at the party, causing laughter among the guests.
meanings.sent4: His jugheads made him a challenge to partner with in the dance competition.
meanings.sent5: The jugheads on the ice rink slipped and slid, much to the amusement of onlookers.
